title: Gabi Zanotti
text:
Gabriela Maria Zanotti Demoner (born 28 February 1985), commonly known as Gabi Zanotti or simply Gabi, is a Brazilian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player for <a href="Sport%20Club%20Corinthians%20Paulista%20%28women%27s%20football%29">Corinthians</a> and the <a href="Brazil%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Brazilian national team</a>. She participated at the <a href="2015%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2015 FIFA Women's World Cup</a>.
Club career.
Between the ages of nine and 14, Gabi played alongside her mother Nailza in a women's football team which competed at regional level. Between 2004 and 2006 she played for <a href="Sociedade%20Esportiva%20Kindermann">Kindermann</a>, based in <a href="Santa%20Catarina%20%28state%29">Santa Catarina</a>. Gabi then played <a href="college%20soccer">college soccer</a> in the United States while attending <a href="Franklin%20Pierce%20University">Franklin Pierce University</a>. She spent the 2010 season playing in the North American <a href="USL%20W-League">W-League</a> for <a href="Hudson%20Valley%20Quickstrike%20Lady%20Blues">Hudson Valley Quickstrike Lady Blues</a>.
In 2011 Gabi played for <a href="Santos%20FC%20%28women%29">Santos</a>, but in early 2012 Santos' <a href="board%20of%20directors">board of directors</a> closed the club women's section. Gabi accompanied <a href="Maurine%20Dorneles%20Gon%C3%A7alves">Maurine</a>, <a href="%C3%89rika">Érika</a> and several other displaced Santos players in <a href="Transfer%20%28association%20football%29">transferring</a> to <a href="Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Desportiva%20Centro%20Ol%C3%ADmpico">Centro Olímpico</a>.
International career.
In July 2013 Gabi represented Brazil at the <a href="Football%20at%20the%202013%20Summer%20Universiade">2013 Summer Universiade</a> in <a href="Kazan">Kazan</a>, Russia. She had already debuted for the senior national team, as a substitute in a 5–2 win over <a href="Mexico%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Mexico</a> at the <a href="2009%20Torneio%20Internacional%20Cidade%20de%20S%C3%A3o%20Paulo%20de%20Futebol%20Feminino">2009 Torneio Internacional Cidade de São Paulo de Futebol Feminino</a>.
She was named as an alternate for the Brazil squad at the <a href="Football%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20tournament">2012 London Olympics</a>. In early 2015 Gabi was included in an 18-month residency programme intended to prepare Brazil's national team for the <a href="2015%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2015 FIFA Women's World Cup</a> in Canada and the <a href="Football%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Olympics">2016 Rio Olympics</a>. At the World Cup, Gabi appeared in just one of Brazil's four matches, as part of a much-changed team in the 1–0 final group game win over <a href="Costa%20Rica%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Costa Rica</a>.
After Brazil's 1–0 second round defeat by <a href="Australia%20women%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">Australia</a>, Gabi remained in Canada as part of the gold medal-winning Brazilian selection at the <a href="Football%20at%20the%202015%20Pan%20American%20Games%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20tournament">2015 Pan American Games</a> in <a href="Toronto">Toronto</a>.
